wikitext.*:
'''''nor-''''' is a verb meaning "run" or "leap" (of men and animals using legs: ''not'' of fluids etc.) in both [[Quenya]] and [[Sindarin]].<ref>{{PE|17}}, pp. 18, 168, 169</ref>

==Other forms in Quenya==
*''norne'' = pa.t. "ran"
*''norta-'' = "make run, specially used of riding horses or other animals" with form ''nortanen'' "I rode"
*''norie, norme'' = "race, running"

==Other forms in Sindarin==
*''noro'' = imperative
*''onur'' = pa.t. "ran"
*''northa-'' = same as Quenya ''norta-''
*''north'' = "a riding, a race (of people running), a charge or gallop"
